title: Europe’s Next Refugee Crisis
sub_head: The EU isn’t ready for millions of Ukrainians if Russia invades.
body:
A Russian invasion of Ukraine would have devastating humanitarian consequences, and one of them might be another refugee crisis in Europe. Let’s hope the Continent does better this time.
Ukraine aspires to join the European Union, though it is still years away from doing so if it ever happens. But Ukrainians already enjoy visa-free travel to the EU, and the country shares a border with EU states Poland, Slovakia, Hungary and Romania. Countless Ukrainian refugees could seek safety in these countries if Vladimir Putin tries to grab more territory.
